description: Provides information about the specified Call Analytics category. To get a list of your Call Analytics categories, use the operation.

parameters.name: CategoryName
parameters.description: The name of the Call Analytics category you want information about. Category names are case sensitive.

nested_items.name: CategoryProperties
nested_items.description: Provides you with the properties of the Call Analytics category you specified in your GetCallAnalyticsCategory request.

nested_items.name: CategoryName
nested_items.description: The name of the Call Analytics category. Category names are case sensitive and must be unique within an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: Rules
nested_items.description: The rules used to define a Call Analytics category. Each category can have between 1 and 20 rules.

nested_items.name: NonTalkTimeFilter
nested_items.description: Flag the presence or absence of periods of silence in your Call Analytics transcription output. Refer to for more detail.

nested_items.name: Threshold
nested_items.description: Specify the duration, in milliseconds, of the period of silence that you want to flag. For example, you can flag a silent period that lasts 30,000 milliseconds.

nested_items.name: AbsoluteTimeRange
nested_items.description: Makes it possible to specify a time range (in milliseconds) in your audio, during which you want to search for a period of silence. See for more detail.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, when Amazon Transcribe starts searching for the specified criteria in your audio. If you include StartTime in your request, you must also include EndTime.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, when Amazon Transcribe stops searching for the specified criteria in your audio. If you include EndTime in your request, you must also include StartTime.

nested_items.name: First
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, from the start of your media file until the specified value. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Last
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, from the specified value until the end of your media file. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: RelativeTimeRange
nested_items.description: Makes it possible to specify a time range (in percentage) in your media file, during which you want to search for a period of silence. See for more detail.

nested_items.name: StartPercentage
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, when Amazon Transcribe starts searching for the specified criteria in your media file. If you include StartPercentage in your request, you must also include EndPercentage.

nested_items.name: EndPercentage
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, when Amazon Transcribe stops searching for the specified criteria in your media file. If you include EndPercentage in your request, you must also include StartPercentage.

nested_items.name: First
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, from the start of your media file until the specified value. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Last
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, from the specified value until the end of your media file. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Negate
nested_items.description: Set to TRUE to flag periods of speech. Set to FALSE to flag periods of silence.

nested_items.name: InterruptionFilter
nested_items.description: Flag the presence or absence of interruptions in your Call Analytics transcription output. Refer to for more detail.

nested_items.name: Threshold
nested_items.description: Specify the duration of the interruptions in milliseconds. For example, you can flag speech that contains more than 10,000 milliseconds of interruptions.

nested_items.name: ParticipantRole
nested_items.description: Specify the interrupter that you want to flag. Omitting this parameter is equivalent to specifying both participants.

nested_items.name: AbsoluteTimeRange
nested_items.description: Makes it possible to specify a time range (in milliseconds) in your audio, during which you want to search for an interruption. See for more detail.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, when Amazon Transcribe starts searching for the specified criteria in your audio. If you include StartTime in your request, you must also include EndTime.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, when Amazon Transcribe stops searching for the specified criteria in your audio. If you include EndTime in your request, you must also include StartTime.

nested_items.name: First
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, from the start of your media file until the specified value. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Last
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, from the specified value until the end of your media file. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: RelativeTimeRange
nested_items.description: Makes it possible to specify a time range (in percentage) in your media file, during which you want to search for an interruption. See for more detail.

nested_items.name: StartPercentage
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, when Amazon Transcribe starts searching for the specified criteria in your media file. If you include StartPercentage in your request, you must also include EndPercentage.

nested_items.name: EndPercentage
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, when Amazon Transcribe stops searching for the specified criteria in your media file. If you include EndPercentage in your request, you must also include StartPercentage.

nested_items.name: First
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, from the start of your media file until the specified value. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Last
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, from the specified value until the end of your media file. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Negate
nested_items.description: Set to TRUE to flag speech that does not contain interruptions. Set to FALSE to flag speech that contains interruptions.

nested_items.name: TranscriptFilter
nested_items.description: Flag the presence or absence of specific words or phrases in your Call Analytics transcription output. Refer to for more detail.

nested_items.name: TranscriptFilterType
nested_items.description: Flag the presence or absence of an exact match to the phrases that you specify. For example, if you specify the phrase 'speak to a manager' as your Targets value, only that exact phrase is flagged.

nested_items.name: AbsoluteTimeRange
nested_items.description: Makes it possible to specify a time range (in milliseconds) in your audio, during which you want to search for the specified key words or phrases. See for more detail.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, when Amazon Transcribe starts searching for the specified criteria in your audio. If you include StartTime in your request, you must also include EndTime.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, when Amazon Transcribe stops searching for the specified criteria in your audio. If you include EndTime in your request, you must also include StartTime.

nested_items.name: First
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, from the start of your media file until the specified value. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Last
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, from the specified value until the end of your media file. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: RelativeTimeRange
nested_items.description: Makes it possible to specify a time range (in percentage) in your media file, during which you want to search for the specified key words or phrases. See for more detail.

nested_items.name: StartPercentage
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, when Amazon Transcribe starts searching for the specified criteria in your media file. If you include StartPercentage in your request, you must also include EndPercentage.

nested_items.name: EndPercentage
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, when Amazon Transcribe stops searching for the specified criteria in your media file. If you include EndPercentage in your request, you must also include StartPercentage.

nested_items.name: First
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, from the start of your media file until the specified value. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Last
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, from the specified value until the end of your media file. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: ParticipantRole
nested_items.description: Specify the participant that you want to flag. Omitting this parameter is equivalent to specifying both participants.

nested_items.name: Negate
nested_items.description: Set to TRUE to flag the absence of the phrase that you specified in your request. Set to FALSE to flag the presence of the phrase that you specified in your request.

nested_items.name: Targets
nested_items.description: Specify the phrases that you want to flag.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SentimentFilter
nested_items.description: Flag the presence or absence of specific sentiments in your Call Analytics transcription output. Refer to for more detail.

nested_items.name: Sentiments
nested_items.description: Specify the sentiments that you want to flag.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AbsoluteTimeRange
nested_items.description: Makes it possible to specify a time range (in milliseconds) in your audio, during which you want to search for the specified sentiments. See for more detail.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, when Amazon Transcribe starts searching for the specified criteria in your audio. If you include StartTime in your request, you must also include EndTime.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, when Amazon Transcribe stops searching for the specified criteria in your audio. If you include EndTime in your request, you must also include StartTime.

nested_items.name: First
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, from the start of your media file until the specified value. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Last
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds, from the specified value until the end of your media file. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: RelativeTimeRange
nested_items.description: Makes it possible to specify a time range (in percentage) in your media file, during which you want to search for the specified sentiments. See for more detail.

nested_items.name: StartPercentage
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, when Amazon Transcribe starts searching for the specified criteria in your media file. If you include StartPercentage in your request, you must also include EndPercentage.

nested_items.name: EndPercentage
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, when Amazon Transcribe stops searching for the specified criteria in your media file. If you include EndPercentage in your request, you must also include StartPercentage.

nested_items.name: First
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, from the start of your media file until the specified value. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: Last
nested_items.description: The time, in percentage, from the specified value until the end of your media file. Amazon Transcribe searches for your specified criteria in this time segment.

nested_items.name: ParticipantRole
nested_items.description: Specify the participant that you want to flag. Omitting this parameter is equivalent to specifying both participants.

nested_items.name: Negate
nested_items.description: Set to TRUE to flag the sentiments that you didn't include in your request. Set to FALSE to flag the sentiments that you specified in your request.

nested_items.name: CreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the specified Call Analytics category was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the specified Call Analytics category was last updated.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, assigned to the specified call analytics category.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The first part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the key is --Department'.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The second part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the value is --Sales'.

nested_items.name: InputType
nested_items.description: The input type associated with the specified category. POST_CALL refers to a category that is applied to batch transcriptions; REAL_TIME refers to a category that is applied to streaming transcriptions.
